intro: Draba helvetica, commonly known as the Swiss bellflower, is a small flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale blue, bloom in early spring, adding a touch of color to the alpine landscape. Draba helvetica is often found in meadows and mountainous areas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
